wiki.content: A Rainbow In Curved Air inspired Pete Townshend's synthesizer parts on The Who's Won't Get Fooled Again" and Baba O'Riley on their album Who's Next. The latter named in tribute to Riley as well as to Meher Baba. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: A Rainbow In Curved Air inspired Pete Townshend's synthesizer parts on The Who's Won't Get Fooled Again" and Baba O'Riley on their album Who's Next. The latter named in tribute to Riley as well as to Meher Baba.

track.name: A Rainbow in Curved Air
comments: I can't believe such a pure piece of electronic music was created in 1968.
Wow, what a trip...wish I was on something to hear this!
making love to a bag of skittles [2] pretty much describes this song
I am in love with this man!This was interesting all the way through

If you love Steve Reich, the Disneyland Main Street Electrical Parade or Baba O'Reilly. If you've ever found yourself skateboarding along a güiro, jumping between sitar strings or making love to a bag of skittles...
I'll have to fix my mind after this one;
If The Journey brought you here: http://www.last.fm/group/This+is+The+Journey
1968 "Terry Riley - A Rainbow In Curved Air" amazing song! famous music.1968!?
just one of the most amazing compositions i have ever heard

Every now and then, I settle in for the specific purpose of listening to this track straight through; it is almost an event of sorts...  I'm not big on minimalist music, but this mesmerizes me; everyone needs to hear this once...
